meanings.def: a person with extensive academic learning in a particular field
meanings.example: The linguistics scholar presented new research on regional dialects.

meanings.def: a student who has been awarded a scholarship
meanings.example: As a first-generation college scholar, she mentors other applicants.

meanings.def: relating to or showing serious academic study
meanings.example: He publishes scholarly articles on medieval trade.

meanings.def: someone distinguished by deep academic learning
meanings.example: The museum consulted a scholarly person to authenticate the manuscript.

meanings.def: advanced knowledge gained through sustained study
meanings.example: Her scholarship on climate history is widely cited.

meanings.def: money awarded to support a student's education
meanings.example: He won a scholarship to attend engineering school.

meanings.def: relating to schools or formal education
meanings.example: The report tracks scholastic progress across the district.

meanings.def: relating to the medieval system of theology and philosophy known as scholasticism
meanings.example: She specializes in scholastic debates about faith and reason.

meanings.def: with respect to academic achievement or study
meanings.example: He has performed scholastically at the top of his class for years.

meanings.def: the medieval Christian system of theology and philosophy that applied Aristotelian logic to faith
meanings.example: The seminar surveys scholasticism and its influence on later theology.

meanings.def: ancient marginal notes or commentaries on classical texts
meanings.example: The edition prints the original poem alongside the surviving scholia.

meanings.def: a scholar who writes explanatory notes on classical literature
meanings.example: Each scholiast offered a different interpretation of the play.

meanings.def: an explanatory note appended to a text, especially a classical or mathematical treatise
meanings.example: The author added a scholium clarifying the theorem's limits.

meanings.def: an institution where students receive instruction
meanings.example: The town built a new school to serve the growing neighborhood.

meanings.def: a large group of fish or other sea creatures swimming together
meanings.example: A school of sardines flashed past the boat.

meanings.def: to teach or train through instruction or practice
meanings.example: The coach schooled the rookies in basic defensive tactics.

meanings.def: work a teacher assigns for students to complete
meanings.example: Tonight's school assignment is to summarize the chapter.

meanings.def: a bell that signals the start or end of a class period
meanings.example: The school bell rang and the hallway filled instantly.

meanings.def: the governing body that sets policy for a local school district
meanings.example: The school board approved the new science curriculum.

meanings.def: a bus used to transport students to and from school
meanings.example: Children lined up as the yellow school bus pulled to the curb.

meanings.def: a pedestrian crossing near a school that is marked for student safety
meanings.example: Volunteers guided families through the busy school crossing.

meanings.def: the daily period during which classes meet
meanings.example: Her school day runs from eight in the morning until three in the afternoon.

meanings.def: a dictionary compiled and formatted for student use
meanings.example: He keeps a school dictionary in his locker for quick reference.

meanings.def: a geographic and administrative unit that operates local public schools
meanings.example: The school district serves more than twenty thousand students.

meanings.def: a newspaper produced by students for their school community
meanings.example: She edits the school newspaper's weekly opinion page.

meanings.def: a professional program that educates and licenses dentists
meanings.example: He applied to the university's school of dentistry after earning his biology degree.

meanings.def: an institution that grants law degrees and trains future attorneys
meanings.example: She chose a school of law known for its public-interest clinics.

meanings.def: an institution that educates and awards degrees to physicians
meanings.example: Clinical rotations begin in the third year of the school of medicine.

meanings.def: an institution that provides advanced education in musical performance or composition
meanings.example: He auditioned for the conservatory's school of music.

meanings.def: a program that trains students to become registered or practical nurses
meanings.example: Clinical placements are required in the second year of the school of nursing.

meanings.def: a group of people who share a particular philosophy or approach
meanings.example: One school of thought favors smaller neighborhood schools.

meanings.def: a newspaper or magazine created by students for their school
meanings.example: The journalism club distributes a monthly school paper.

meanings.def: an anxiety disorder marked by an intense fear of attending school
meanings.example: Therapy helped reduce his school phobia and ease morning drop-offs.

meanings.def: the lead administrator responsible for running a school
meanings.example: The school principal greeted families at the open house.

meanings.def: a vessel used to train cadets or apprentices in seamanship
meanings.example: Cadets spend a semester aboard the school ship learning navigation.

meanings.def: the chief executive who oversees a school district
meanings.example: The school superintendent proposed a new literacy initiative.

meanings.def: the network of schools governed by shared policies and administration
meanings.example: The city expanded its school system to accommodate new residents.

meanings.def: a teacher who works at a primary or secondary school
meanings.example: Every school teacher received new laptops for lesson planning.

meanings.def: one of the divisions of the academic year during which classes are held
meanings.example: Students select electives at the start of each school term.

meanings.def: a textbook prepared for classroom instruction
meanings.example: The new history school text includes primary sources and maps.

meanings.def: the annual period during which a school operates, usually from late summer to spring
meanings.example: The school year begins in August and ends the following May.

meanings.def: a child old enough to attend compulsory primary or secondary school
meanings.example: The survey focuses on nutrition among school-age children.

meanings.def: a bag used to carry books and supplies to school
meanings.example: She packed her schoolbag with notebooks and a packed lunch.

meanings.def: a textbook used in school lessons
meanings.example: He covered each schoolbook with protective paper.

meanings.def: a boy who attends school
meanings.example: The schoolboy hurried to practice after class.

meanings.def: characteristic of a schoolboy, especially in a youthful or awkward way
meanings.example: He flashed a schoolboyish grin when the plan succeeded.

meanings.def: a child who attends school
meanings.example: Each schoolchild received a free library card.

meanings.def: the period of a person's life spent attending school
meanings.example: They have remained friends since their schooldays.

meanings.def: someone who attends the same school as another
meanings.example: He ran into a schoolfellow at the alumni event.

meanings.def: a friend made while attending school
meanings.example: She planned a reunion with her oldest schoolfriend.

meanings.def: a girl who attends school
meanings.example: The schoolgirl balanced her violin case on the bus.

meanings.def: resembling a schoolgirl, especially in a naive or giggly way
meanings.example: They exchanged schoolgirlish laughter over the inside joke.

meanings.def: a building where a school operates
meanings.example: The historic schoolhouse now serves as a community center.

meanings.def: education or instruction received at school
meanings.example: Access to quality schooling remains uneven across regions.

meanings.def: training that develops a particular skill or discipline
meanings.example: Years of ballet schooling gave her remarkable poise.

meanings.def: an old-fashioned term for a woman schoolteacher
meanings.example: The novel portrays a frontier schoolma'am determined to educate every child.

meanings.def: a male scholar or teacher, especially one associated with scholastic philosophy
meanings.example: The lecture compared the views of several thirteenth-century schoolmen.

meanings.def: a stereotype of a strict or prim woman schoolteacher
meanings.example: She softened her schoolmarm reputation by hosting art clubs after class.

meanings.def: a man who teaches or leads a school, especially as headmaster
meanings.example: The schoolmaster welcomed the new pupils at assembly.

meanings.def: a person who attends the same school as another
meanings.example: She reunited with a schoolmate from fifth grade.

meanings.def: a woman who teaches or runs a school
meanings.example: The schoolmistress maintained a calm, orderly classroom.

meanings.def: a classroom where lessons take place
meanings.example: Sunlight poured into the restored one-room schoolroom.

meanings.def: a teacher who works at a primary or secondary school
meanings.example: The schoolteacher organized a field trip to the science museum.

meanings.def: the hours when classes are held or, more broadly, the period of one's schooling
meanings.example: During schooltime the playground is reserved for students.

meanings.def: affecting or involving the entire school
meanings.example: They launched a schoolwide campaign to reduce waste.

meanings.def: assignments and study required for school courses
meanings.example: He finished his schoolwork before soccer practice.
